metadata.title: CVE-2017-16654 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in Symfony before 2.7.38, 2.8.31, 3.2.14, 3.3.13,3.4-BETA5, and 4.0-BETA5. The Intl component includes various bundlereaders that are used to read resource bundles from the local filesystem.The read() methods of these classes use a path and a locale to determinethe language bundle to retrieve. The locale argument value is commonlyretrieved from untrusted user input (like a URL parameter). An attacker canuse this argument to navigate to arbitrary directories via thedot-dot-slash attack, aka Directory Traversal.

criterions.comment: symfony: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
